title: Optics - Conditions for total internal reflection

content.prompt: If θ i is varied, is it possible for the beam to be totally internally reflected? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because a portion of the beam is always reflected back whenever it encounters a new medium
Yes, because there will be an incident angle for which the refracted angle is 90°
No, because a transparent medium must allow light to travel through it
No, because the beam will always refract toward the normal when going into a medium of greater index of refraction

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
